answers.answer: Sometimes we see an interferon "hangover" which can last as long as a year in some people. Sounds like yours are lasting somewhat longer. They should go away soon and indeed they sound like they are lessening. You may benefit from an antidepressant which will help the symptoms until they are gone.  DTD

I completed 46 weeks of treatment.  I stopped 2 weeks early do to the difficulties i was having.  I too continue to have medication symptoms 5 months after stopping the meds.  I have not been as lucky as I just found out yesterday that my Hep C is positive again.  I was just devastated.  When I found out that meds could remain is system for an undetermined amount of time I again felt heartbroken.  To help me cope I began to start a journal.  I am very undisciplined so I do not write daily.  Anyway I try very hard to write somethem positive.  My hair is finally growing back.  I went 2 days without throwing up.  Sometimes just writing something as simple as 1 conversation without forgetting anything.  My suggestions may not be helpful but just knowing you are not alone.  If sx continues you may also wish to see a physcian.  Some of your symptoms can be indidicative of another medical issue.  Take care God Bless
